title: What are the "dangers to the soul" in modern times, and how do they differ from the beliefs in magic and superstition of ancient civilizations?
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author discusses the concept of magic and how it relates to the human psyche's fragile state. last_phrase: In conclusion, it can be said that the concept of "dangers of the soul" is not limited to primitive societies only, but it can also prevail in modern societies, albeit in a subtler form. The existential threat to the human personality is greater than ever today, as the modern man is exposed to various psychic influences, ideologies, and subtle thought patterns which can dominate him without his knowledge. It is essential to be aware of such "soul dangers" and protect our individuality from the forces that can compromise it.
